notes.text:
Updated Red Hat OpenShift Distributed Tracing 2.8 container images are now
available.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The Red Hat OpenShift Distributed Tracing 2.8 container images have been updated. CVE-2022-41717 was fixed as part of this release.

Users of Red Hat OpenShift Distributed Tracing 2.8 container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs, and add these enhancements.

Tempo Operator added as Tech Preview.

You can find images updated by this advisory in Red Hat Container Catalog (see
References).

Security Fix(es):

* golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests (CVE-2022-41717)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, see the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in the net/http library of the golang package. This flaw allows an attacker to cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Within Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform, the grafana container is listed as will not fix. Since OCP 4.10, Grafana itself is not shipped and the Grafana web server is protected behind an OAuth proxy server.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

To update all RPMs for your particular architecture, run:

rpm -Fvh [filenames]

where [filenames] is a list of the RPMs you wish to upgrade.  Only those
RPMs which are currently installed will be updated.  Those RPMs which are
not installed but included in the list will not be updated.  Note that you
can also use wildcards (*.rpm) if your current directory *only* contains the
desired RPMs.

Please note that this update is also available via Red Hat Network.  Many
people find this an easier way to apply updates.  To use Red Hat Network,
launch the Red Hat Update Agent with the following command:

up2date

This will start an interactive process that will result in the appropriate
RPMs being upgraded on your system.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests
